item.title: MaryKay add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Although the world is full of suffering, it is full also of the overcoming of it." -- Helen Keller

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "You can often change your circumstances by changing your attitude" -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "...for love casts out fear, and gratitude can conquer pride." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Joseph Smith Jr.
item.description: "A man is saved no faster than he gains knowledge" -- Joseph Smith Jr.

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Ian Wallace
item.description: "Why are you trying so hard to fit in when you were born to stand out?" -- Ian Wallace

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Learn from the mistakes of others. You can’t live long enough to make them all yourself. " -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart" -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "It is not fair to ask of others what you are not willing to do yourself." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Chieko N. Okazaki
item.description: "If we don't have time for masterpiece moments, the very reason we came to earth is being wasted on us." -- Chieko N. Okazaki

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Harriet Tubman
item.description: "Twant me, 'twas the Lord. I always told him, 'I trust to you. I don't know where to go or what to do, but I expect you to lead me,' and He always did." -- Harriet Tubman

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Marie Curie
item.description: "Nothing in life is to be feared. It is only to be understood." -- Marie Curie

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Temple Grandin
item.description: "You simply cannot tell other people they are stupid, even if they really are stupid." -- Temple Grandin

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Temple Grandin
item.description: "Nature is cruel but we don't have to be" -- Temple Grandin

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Nelson Mandela
item.description: "Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world." -- Nelson Mandela

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face. You are able to say to yourself, 'I have lived through this horror. I can take the next thing that comes along.' You must do the thing you think you cannot do." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Carrie Chapman Catt
item.description: "More powerful than kings and armies is an idea whose time has come to move." -- Carrie Chapman Catt

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Nelson Mandela
item.description: "There is no passion to be found playing small - in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living." -- Nelson Mandela

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "God's viewpoint is sometimes different from ours - so different that we could not even guess at it unless He had given us a Book which tells us such things....In the Bible I learn that God values us not for our strenght or our brains but simply because He has made us." -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "In darkness God's truth shines most clear." -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Corrie ten Boom
item.description: "Never be afraid to trust an unknown future to a known God." -- Corrie ten Boom

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "And for all these people alike, the key to healing turned out to be the same. Each had a hurt he had to forgive." -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "Is prayer your steering wheel or your spare tire?" -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Desmond Tutu
item.description: "Like when you sit in front of a fire in winter — you are just there in front of the fire. You don't have to be smart or anything. The fire warms you." -- Desmond Tutu

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Mignon McLaughlin
item.description: "Don't be yourself. Be someone a little nicer." -- Mignon McLaughlin

item.title: MaryKay add a quote by Mignon McLaughlin
item.description: "Every society honors its live conformists and its dead troublemakers." -- Mignon McLaughlin
